WritableStream.summary:
The WritableStream interface of the Streams API provides a standard abstraction for writing streaming data to a destination, known as a sink.
This object comes with built-in backpressure and queuing.

WritableStreamAbort.summary: The abort() method of the interface aborts the stream, signaling that the producer can no longer successfully write to the stream and it is to be immediately moved to an error state, with any queued writes discarded.
WritableStreamAbort.returns: A , which fulfills with the value given in the reason parameter.

WritableStreamClose.summary: The close() method of the interface closes the associated stream. All chunks written before this method is called are sent before the returned promise is fulfilled.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to getting a with , calling on it.

WritableStreamClose.returns:
A which fulfills with the undefined when all
remaining chunks were successfully written before the close, or rejects with an error if
a problem was encountered during the process.

WritableStreamGetWriter.summary:
The getWriter() method of the interface returns a new instance of and locks the stream to that instance.
While the stream is locked, no other writer can be acquired until this one is released.

WritableStreamLocked.summary: The locked read-only property of the interface returns a boolean indicating whether the WritableStream is locked to a writer.
WritableStreamLocked.value: A boolean value indicating whether or not the writable stream is locked.

WritableStreamWritableStream.summary: The WritableStream() constructor creates a new object instance.
